pulltitle: Drop Python 2.6 compatibility, add Python 3.6/3.7 compatibility
pullsbody:
[Python 2 reaches EOL in less than a year now](https://pythonclock.org/). AMO needs to migrate to Python 3, and basket-client is one of its [last remaining dependencies](https://github.com/mozilla/addons-server/issues/4997) that isn't compatible.

The CircleCI configuration should also be amended to run under both versions of Python, and this PR might require more work if you still care about Python 2.6 compatibility (which I removed in this PR because I had to drop `unittest2`, which wasn't behaving properly - using the version included in python instead works just fine), but I figured this would get the conversation going, at least.
pull_repo_desc: Python library for connecting to Basket
pull_commit_message: Drop Python 2.6 compatibility, add Python 3.6/3.7 compatibility

The CircleCI configuration should also be amended to run under both versions of Python, and this PR might require more work if you still care about Python 2.6 compatibility (which I removed in this PR because I had to drop `unittest2`, which wasn't behaving properly - using the version included in python instead works just fine), but I figured this would get the conversation going, at least.

pulltitle: Add mock success and failure email address handling
pullsbody:
Now calling e.g. `basket.subscribe('success@example.com`, 'firefox')`
will not call basket and will return success. Similarly using
the email address`failure@example.com`will raise a
`BasketException`.
pull_repo_desc: Python library for connecting to Basket

pulltitle: Bug 922759 - Pass Basket numeric error codes to callers
pullsbody:
- Pass error codes from Basket back to callers as a new attribute on BasketException
- Define the error codes here in basket-client where callers can use them. Basket will add basket-client as a submodule, just so Basket can respond with the same error numbers.

pull_commit_message:
Add get_newsletters API

Bug 841426

pullsbody:
The requests library can fail the request with a Timeout exception.
If the user of basket-client wants to catch BasketException when
there's an error on its request, it probably expects timeouts to be
included, and not to have to explicitly catch the request library's
Timeout exception. So catch that in basket-client and raise the
expected BasketException.
pull_repo_desc: Python library for connecting to Basket
pull_commit_message:
Handle Timeout from request

The requests library can fail the request with a Timeout exception.
If the user of basket-client wants to catch BasketException when
there's an error on its request, it probably expects timeouts to be
included, and not to have to explicitly catch the request library's
Timeout exception. So catch that in basket-client and raise the
expected BasketException.

pulltitle: Update contact info and add env var setting support.
pullsbody:
- Change contacts from mkelly and jlong to the mozilla.org
  dev mailing list.
- Since this should not be a Django-only lib, add support
  for specifying the basket_url via environment variable.

In future we should consider making this a class with
the option of providing the URL on instantiation.
pull_repo_desc: Python library for connecting to Basket
pull_commit_message:
Update contact info and add env var setting support.

* Change contacts from mkelly and jlong to the mozilla.org
  dev mailing list.
* Since this should not be a Django-only lib, add support
  for specifying the basket_url via environment variable.
